title: Malay language
summary: Malay (/məˈleɪ/;[6] Malay: bahasa Melayu, Jawi: بهاس ملايو‎, Rejang: ꤷꥁꤼ ꤸꥍꤾꤿꥈ) is an Austronesian language officially spoken in Indonesia, Brunei, Malaysia and Singapore and unofficially spoken in East Timor and parts of Thailand. It is spoken by 290 million people[7] (around 260 million in Indonesia alone in its own literary standard named "Indonesian")[8] across the Malay world.
